fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an image is added from an external source, it will not be added to the page, but, use the URL as a reference to having it displayed on the page.

In this case, when a [link is added to an image|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-links-and-anchors/] from an external source, once the user taps the image, it will be previewed instead of redirecting the user to the link, even that the image still has the link added to it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) To reproduce this issue, you must [convert a legacy editor page to the current one|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/] as the current editor has a suggestion to add images from the web, and its workaround will actually upload the image.
 # Have a page using the legacy editor.
 # There, make sure to open the dialog to [upload an image|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/display-files-and-images/#Displayfilesandimages-legacyeditor] and select the *Images from the web* option.
 # Paste the URL of an external image and save the change.
 # Publish the page to have the content saved.
 # Now, edit the page again, and then, [convert it to the new editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/].
 # Publish the page again and tap the image with the link.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be redirected to the link.
h3. Actual Results

A preview of the image is opened and the user is not redirected to the link as the link is still added to the image (which can be confirmed by editing the page and then, editing the link).
h3. Workaround
 * Manually [upload the images|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/display-files-and-images/#Displayfilesandimages-neweditor] and add the link to them.
 * Open the image's preview and then, with a right-click, select the *Copy image* option. Once this is done, paste the image to the page (while editing it) and re-add the link. This will also upload the image to the page.
fields.summary: Links added to images from external sources will not redirect the user to the link

fields.description:
When embedding the Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan macro to a page, there is no way to choose the default parameters of the table (i.e column width, fields that are minimized or not). At the moment, each user must manually choose what parameters are best for them.

It would be nice if the users could adjust the Jira plan with specific parameters that are best for their teams (i.e. column width, which fields are minimized). This makes it difficult for other users to see the correct information in the table. For example, depending on the default column width, sometimes the name of the issues does not appear in full.
fields.summary: Allow users to set default parameters for the Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding the Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan macro in the Excerpt macro, it works fines. However, when using the Excerpt include macro to show information from the Advanced Roadmaps, it only shows the URL of the roadmap.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*In Jira:*
# Create a plan with advanced roadmaps.
# Copy the link of the plan to embed it to Confluence.

*In Confluence:*
# Create a page.
# Add the Excerpt macro.
# Inside the excerpt macro, add the Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan macro.
# Create another page and add the Excerpt Include macro.
# Choose to show information from the first page created.

h3. Expected Results
The Jira plan should show up on the page having the Excerpt include macro.
h3. Actual Results
The Jira plan doesn't show up on the page having the Excerpt include macro. Only the link to the plan will appear:
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-30 at 11.35.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excerpt include macro doesn't recognize the Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan macro

fields.description:
The request is to inform the site admins if any standard global template is added with the new release of confluence so that they can check if that needs to be enabled/disabled for the users.

For now, if any new global templates are added to Confluence standard templates, then that is enabled by default which should not be the case.
fields.summary: The new global templates are activated by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create multiple issues from the table Will either not create the issue if there is an Embedded Video or Give an error if the Cell contains an Image
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a two or more Column table
 # Add an image or video to a cell within the table
 # Publish page
 # Select *[Create Issue|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-jira-and-confluence-together/]* from Text in Column in table
 # Make sure the *Description* column corresponds with the image or video previously added to the table.
 # Create tickets.

h3. Expected Results

Image or video added to the table should display in the associated ticket created from the table.
h3. Actual Results

If it is only a Video in the cell no ticket is created. If it is an image or file a link will be provided.
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only know workaround would be to directly attach the images or videos to the ticket.
fields.summary: When Creating multiple issues from table Will  if there is a Embedded Video or Give an error if the Cell contains an Image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira issue macro does not display values of the Security Level from Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue security level scheme in Jira and associate it with a Jira project.
 # Create some issues in the project and set Issue Security for some issues.
 # Go to Confluence and create a page, use Jira-issue macro, and using a filter display the Jira issues recently created with the issue security set.
 # Ensure to select table under *display options*(in Jira issue macro) and select *Security Level* field in the *Columns to display*
|!image-2021-03-29-22-22-06-173.png|width=146,height=90!|

h3. Expected Results

The Security level should display the level that is set in Jira.
|!image-2021-03-29-22-23-44-034.png|width=257,height=73!|

h3. Actual Results
The Security Level does not display anything!
|!image-2021-03-29-22-25-22-755.png|width=343,height=55!|


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira issue macro does not display values of the Security Level from Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Label/Chart information for JIRA Chart macro not being displayed correctly while exporting to PDF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with the current editor.
 # Insert the *JIRA Chart* macro.
 # Select the *Pie Chart*.
 # Use JQL to search for your JIRA data.
 # On the *Display options*, use the default Width *200*, and let checked *Show border* and *Show chart information*.
 (i) I was able to replicate using *Assignee* and *Status* on +Chart+.
 # Publish the page.
 # Export the page to PDF.

h3. Expected Results
The macro should render correctly the chart showing all the information with no further issues.
|!chart_ok.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Actual Results
The label/chart information is rendered above the chart.
|!chart_nok.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Workaround
On the Display options from the macro, change the field Width from +200+ to *280*.
fields.summary: Label for JIRA Chart macro not being displayed correctly while exporting to PDF

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
At this time users can create a subscription for page and space admins can create space subscriptions. These users don't need to have admin permission.

h3.Suggested Solution
Add a global permission to restrict the users who can create a subscription.
fields.summary: Add the ability to restrict Slack integration to Confluence admins
JIRA macro > Display a List of Subtasks

fields.description:
With the Slack add-on we can create a slack post for a new blog post or page in a space.

However, to keep things organized it would be better if a filter can be added so we only create a post for pages with a certain label or with a specific word in the title, under a certain parent folder etc...

For me, a change to the pending reviews page should go into the documentation channel, but a change to release notes goes into the releases channel...
fields.summary: Limit Slack posts based on filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It appears the Confluence rate limiting of the CQL search endpoint, `/rest/api/search?cql=`, is flawed with respect to the returned status code since 400 responses are observed when the endpoint is pushed hard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that invokes the CQL search endpoint repeatedly in quick succession until a non 200 response is returned. 
 # Observe the non 200 response code.

h3. Expected Results

The response status code at step 2 is 429.
h3. Actual Results

The response status code at step 2 is 400.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Incorrect status code returned when being rate limited

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, it is possible to work with view-only users by enabling the view space anonymous permissions to a space, and then add users to our site without product access. 

Though this is a very useful feature, it doesn't prevent us to accidentally grant these users product access by mistake.

h3. Suggestion
Create a button/label to flag active users without a Confluence license as view-only users, so this way while this label is active for the users we add it, they won't be able to be added on groups that grant product access on Confluence.
fields.summary: View-only users flag

fields.description:
In Atlassian, there is the possibility to list all the pages where you are mentioned with @name in a task.

It would be equally useful to have a list of all the pages where a user is mentioned with @name comments.
fields.summary: List of all the pages where a user is mentioned with @name in comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, it’s not possible to hide archived pages altogether. It can only be done page by page.

h3. Proposed Solution

It would be nice to allow customers to add restrictions to a page parent, replicating to its children pages.
fields.summary: Inherited Restrictions should be respected when Archiving Pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

illuminated letter symbols 🇦 🇪 🇱 🇵 🇹 in template "Content design glossary" shows unicode for anonymous access users
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page with "Content design glossary" Template
 # Enable anonymous access
 # Access thew page as an anonymous user or incognito window

h3. Expected Results

The page should not show Unicodes for the Illuminated letter symbols 
h3. Actual Results

illuminated letter symbols 🇦 🇪 🇱 🇵 🇹 appear as Unicode for anonymous users 
 !image-2021-03-26-18-46-31-283.png|width=432,height=138! 
  
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: illuminated letter symbols 🇦 🇪 🇱 🇵 🇹 in template "Content design glossary" shows unicode for anonymous access users

fields.description:
*Summary*

The [Questions for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211644/questions-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] addon in the Atlassian marketplace provides the facility to create Questions and Answers in Confluence. This is very useful in a collaborative environment to share knowledge via internal Q&A. However for better insights into these discussions analytics will be helpful. 

1) Number of questions being answered by a specific person
2) Average turnaround time for questions asked in a Space.
3) Number of times a specific question was viewed.
4) Configuration on who can 'check mark' the answers.
fields.summary: Analytics for Questions for Confluence addon available in the Atlassian Marketplace

fields.description:
I have a page with a table, and a linked title in a cell. The item has an inline comment:

!image-2021-03-25-10-08-44-753.png|width=257,height=142!

On mouseover, the title is completely obscured by the hovering link, so I can't click on it to see the comment:

!image-2021-03-25-10-09-11-408.png|width=247,height=115!

I've reproduced this on a fixed-width page.
h3. Workaround

Select a different comment on the page and use arrows to navigate to this one.
fields.summary: Inline comment on text in a table obscured by pop-up link

fields.description:
On the new Team Calendars UI, the events are showing up on the days slots, but you have to click on the "+ more" events to show the other events, while on the old team calendar view, they all would show up.

Also, when you create an event, it only shows the title option for event, it no longer shows the event details.

For example:
Title: Out Sick
Who: User

Now on the new Calendar UI it only shows the title "Out Sick", on the old calendar it would show up the "User:Title" for the event Out Sick.

This suggestion is to bring it back, as on some use cases, it is heavily needed to know who is on leave and why, without having to go on extra clicks for all events on all days.


As a workaround, the old UI still can be seen on the https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action URL and on the Team Calendar macro inserted on a Confluence page.
fields.summary: Add an option to show events details on the Team Calendars UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's a cross-reference to 
https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/SCALE-3851
as mentioned in comments to PIR 
https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/PIR-8241?focusedCommentId=1122170&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1122170

h3. Steps to Reproduce
No steps to reproduce

h3. Expected Results
No impact visible to customer

h3. Actual Results
No impact visible to customer

h3. Workaround
No workaround needed, no user-facing changes
fields.summary: Add tests that cover termination of poller on quick reload

fields.description:
This is a clone of CONFCLOUD-71804. Creating a new one as it is a security breach.
h3. Issue Summary

When a user [shares a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-a-page-or-blog-post/] with a group that does not have [product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/update-product-access-settings/] to Confluence and it includes users that do not have product access to Confluence, a notification will be sent to these users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have an account that is included in the site, but, does not have site access at all, like the example below:
 !user_access.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a group and add this account to it. This group should not have product access to Confluence.
 # Share a page with the group.

h3. Expected Results

Only users with access to Confluence should receive the notification.
h3. Actual Results

Users without product access to Confluence will receive a notification for the page being shared. When trying to access it, the users will not be able to view it as they can't access Confluence.

(i) The user will not receive an invite/be granted access to Confluence as well.

*Additional notes*
 * If the group has product access to Confluence, as soon as the user has the access revoked from Confluence, the user is removed from the group, avoiding the bug to happen.
 * Even though the group does not have product access to Confluence, it will still be allowed to have a page shared with it.
 * If the group and user do not have product access to Confluence, but the account has site access, when the page is shared with the group, the user will be granted product access to Confluence automatically as mentioned in the [Share page article|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-a-page-or-blog-post/]

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sharing a page with a group without product access will send notification to users without access to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira macro does not display the letter case of the field name accurately.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a custom field in Jira Cloud with a name starting with two capital letters (example CC Approval Date)
 2. Insert Jira Macros in the Confluence Cloud page.
 3. Select the Display option to display your custom field
 4. Publish the page

in Jira
|!image-2021-03-24-12-44-12-348.png|width=309,height=68!|

In Confluence:
|!image-2021-03-24-12-44-40-829.png|width=184,height=122!|!image-2021-03-24-12-44-55-302.png|width=242,height=112!|
h3. Expected Results

All field names should be exactly displayed as they were created in Jira.
h3. Actual Results

The field that begins with two capital letters is written with one small letter.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Jira macro does not display the letter case of the field name accurately

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the available add-ons to integrate with Sharepoint will either require every user's authentication or don't provide two-ways integration. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an integration with Sharepoint to display Sharepoint documents on Confluence, as well as Confluence pages on Sharepoint, that also don't require every user to authenticate.
fields.summary: Two-ways sharepoint integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The audit log retention is currently set to 3 years. It would be nice if it was extended to longer.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence Audit Log
 # Only can retain data for 3 years

h3. Expected Results

Longer, 5-10 years possibly.
h3. Actual Results

Retention period is 3 years
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Extend audit log retention

fields.description:
When using the Analytics app to [view insights on the site|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/view-insights-on-your-site/], it is possible to review the search terms used by users to get insights on what is being searched within Confluence. However, there is no option to export such data.

h3.Suggestion

Aligned with the *Spaces* and *Users* options, this is a suggestion to allow the search terms analytics to be exported as well. 

(i) As a workaround, the user can manually copy and paste the results in a CSV or spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Allow exporting of search results in Analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Jira Macro to create an issue in Jira, if the project selected has a date field set as required, the Jira macro will create the issue in Jira but the value will be different from the Macro and the issue created by *two days*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
First you have to have a date field set as required for a project
# Access a page in Confluence and add the Jira Macro
# Select the option "Create New Issue"
# Select the project and issue type with the required date field
# Add the values for all the fields, including the date field, and click on "Insert"

h3. Expected Results
The same value added should be on Jira issue
h3. Actual Results
The Jira issue is created but the value is different by two days.

Confluence is sending the correct information to Jira, as we can confirm below:
 !image (12).png|thumbnail! 
{code}
request: /wiki/rest/jira-integration/1.0/issues?applicationId=*********
payload "{\"issues\":[{\"fields\":{\"project\":{\"id\":\"10000\"},\"issuetype\":{\"id\":\"10004\"},\"summary\":\"test date\",\"description\":\"\",\"customfield_10057\":\"21-03-20\",\"duedate\":\"21-03-22\"}}]}"
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Using Jira Macro to create an issue in Jira makes a required date field to receive a wrong value in Jira

fields.description:
h4. Summary

In Confluence Cloud New Editor, when inserting links you can choose to display that URL as a link or as a card.
If you choose the “Display as a card” option with a URL from a page from the instance, it automatically adds a phrase to inform where that page can be located.

h4. Solution

It would be nice to allow customers to customize that smart card, adding a brief description of the content of that page and/or other information about it.
fields.summary: Ability to edit Smart Card description for links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Anonymous users with view permission only can delete labels in the UI but they are not actually deleted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in a Confluence space open to anonymous users
 # Make sure the anonymous users have only view permission
 # Add some labels to the page and save it
 # Go to an incognito/private tab and open the page created
 # Check the labels

h3. Expected Results

The labels don't have an "x" to delete them.
h3. Actual Results

The labels have an "x" and if you click them, the label is deleted. However, after refreshing the page, the label is back. This is an example of the request made when clicking the "x"
{quote}[{"errors":[{"message":"com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.PermissionException: Could not delete label from content with id ContentId
Unknown macro: \{id=515997726}
","locations":[
Unknown macro: \{"line"}
],"path":["deleteLabel","deleteLabel"],"extensions":{"http":
Unknown macro: \{"status"}
}}],"data":\{"deleteLabel":null}}]
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

*Developer note:* Please check that its for any user who does not have edit perms (not just anons)
fields.summary: Anonymous users with view permission only can delete labels in the UI but they are not actually deleted

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
 When we add an image inside a bullet or numbered list, it is not possible to change the image position. 
 The floating toolbar for image settings doesn't load the alignment options.

 *Suggestion*
 It would be nice to allow customers to customize this alignment on those lists, like we have inside the page.
fields.summary: Ability to change images alignment inside bullet/numbered lists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
OAuth token requests from the Confluence instance to the Jira instance get blocked by the IP allowlist
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # have two separate cloud sites: 
* <confluence-site>.atlassian.net
* <jira-site>.atlassian.net
# set up IP allowlisting as per https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/
# include Atlassian IP addresses and Domains to allowlist to ensure these will not be blocked - https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/ip-addresses-and-domains-for-atlassian-cloud-products/
# set up Application Link between Jira and Confluence as per https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/use-applinks-to-link-to-atlassian-products/

h3. Expected Results
When setting the applinks, OAuth should be established on both ends 
h3. Actual Results
Applink from Confluence to Jira is not connecting, user is asked to "Authenticate to see status" and resulting in an error: "Authentication Failed", an OAuth related error and ""Failed to get token from service provider" 

h3. Workaround
Contact support. This will be analysed and a temporary workaround will be suggested.
fields.summary: OAuth token requests from the Confluence instance to the Jira instance get blocked by the IP allowlist

fields.description:
During HOT-94562, we turned on a FF and generated a higher number of PRS calls. PRS did not have problem for most of that duration but it took much longer to respond from time to time, even during low traffic in the evening. We should understand what resource was strained. Depending on the understanding, we can, as follow-up, 

* Relax the limitation on the resource
* Add monitoring on the resource
* Avoid straining the resource in future design.

https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~757845917/pages/1051337768/Analysis+of+PIR-8525+HOT-94562
fields.summary: Understand the strained PRS resource during HOT-94562
Exporting pages to PDF takes a long time if the page contains a JIRA Issue macro with a JQL query that searches for issues on many projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting multiples pages to PDF, while it is possible 'export' the pages on the *space settings > content tools > export*, when you attempt to click to download it, it returns an error 403, refusing to authorize the download.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence
 # Make sure to have no administrator groups for the user or space admin permissions
 # Go to the Export PDF option in the Space settings (*space settings > content tools > export*) and click custom > export to PDF
 # On the screen to export PDF, choose the pages to export, click on download

h3. Expected Results

The PDF would download as expected .
h3. Actual Results

If you are not part of administrators, site-admins user or a space administrator, the PDF won't be downloaded and you will get a 403 error instead.
h3. Workaround

 There is no workaround at the moment to export multiples pages at once. It can be exported single pages instead, by accessing the pages and clicking on export to PDF.
fields.summary: Downloading from Space Export to PDF is returning 403 error for non administrators users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for attachments using the Livesearch macro on Confluence, you won't be able to see the attachment if you click it through the search dropdown. You get the following error message: *"Oops, you've found a broken link"*
  !Screen Shot 2021-03-17 at 13.03.28-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Livesearch macro to a page.
 # Search for the name of an attachment on your site.
 # Click on it via the dropdown, as in the image below:
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-17 at 13.12.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to see the page with the attachment.
h3. Actual Results

The user receives an error message: *"Oops, you've found a broken link"*
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to click on the magnifying glass after searching for the attachment. On the following screen, you can choose the attachment you want and will be redirected to the correct page.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro takes you to a broken link when trying to open attachments through the search dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user [shares a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-a-page-or-blog-post/] with a group that does not have [product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/update-product-access-settings/] to Confluence and it includes users that do not have product access to Confluence, a notification will be sent to these users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have an account that is included in the site, but, does not have site access at all, like the example below:
 !user_access.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a group and add this account to it. This group should not have product access to Confluence.
 # Share a page with the group.

h3. Expected Results

Only users with access to Confluence should receive the notification.
h3. Actual Results

Users without product access to Confluence will receive a notification for the page being shared. When trying to access it, the users will not be able to view it as they can't access Confluence.

(i) The user will not receive an invite/be granted access to Confluence as well.

*Additional notes*
 * If the group has product access to Confluence, as soon as the user has the access revoked from Confluence, the user is removed from the group, avoiding the bug to happen.
 * Even though the group does not have product access to Confluence, it will still be allowed to have a page shared with it.
 * If the group and user do not have product access to Confluence, but the account has site access, when the page is shared with the group, the user will be granted product access to Confluence automatically as mentioned in the [Share page article|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-a-page-or-blog-post/]

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sharing a page with a group without product access will send notification to users without access to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Custom field type for Risk Probability and Risk Consequenc from the bigPicture Plugin are not populating in Jira issue macro

On Jira:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step Install the [bigPicture|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212259/bigpicture-project-management-ppm?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] from the Market Place
 # Step On a Jira Project, create an issue and choose the issue type
 # Step Go to the Project Settings > Screens and click on the default screen scheme for the issue type used in the issue created
 # Step Add the value for custom field in the issue.
 !image-2021-03-17-20-31-17-378.png|thumbnail! 

On Confluence:
 # Step Go to a Confluence Page
 # Step Add the Jira issue macro
 # Step Copy the link from the Jira issue and paste on the macro
 # Step Click on Display Options and switch to Table
 # Step On Columns to display, add the custom field *Risk Probability and Risk Consequenc*
 !image-2021-03-17-20-31-32-957.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The column would display the custom field from bigPicture

h3. Actual Results
he column from the custom field from bigPicture is not shown on the Jira issue macro, but other custom fields from Jira are.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field types from bigPicture are not populating in Jira issue macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Custom Font Files might cause rendering issues on PDF Export

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a custom font to Confluence through [PDF Export Language Support|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-a-pdf-in-another-language/]
# Export a page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
Everything renders as expected.

h3. Actual Results
Some headings/characters might not be displayed correctly.

(!) This doesn't happen for all fonts (!)

h3. Workaround

* Revert back to Confluence default font on [PDF Export Language Support|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-a-pdf-in-another-language/]
* Install a different font, as suggested in this KB: [Special characters not exported to PDF|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/special-characters-not-exported-to-pdf-1026048337.html]
fields.summary: Custom Font Files might cause rendering issues on PDF Export

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When filtering by space while [searching for pages and posts|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/search-for-pages-and-posts/], the expectation is that the "_Pages under_" autocomplete limits to that space.

Instead, the autocomplete includes all pages, not only the pages in the specified space.
h3. Suggested Solution

Filter results based on selected space.
h3. Workaround

[Insert the Livesearch macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-livesearch-macro/] on a page, or refer to advanced Confluence search syntax.
 * [Advanced searching using CQL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/advanced-searching-using-cql/]
 * [Confluence search syntax|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/confluence-search-syntax/]
fields.summary: Advanced (full) Search should adjust filter autocomplete results based on specified space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Issue macro does not display paragraph field from Next-gen project intermittently

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Jira create a *Paragraph* field in a Next-gen project
# Create some issues in that project, ensure the field has some text filled
# Use Jira issue macro on confluence and display the filter results, ensure the field is added in the column

h3. Expected Results
The Paragraph field should display the values in the Jira macro issue output/results on the Confluence page

h3. Actual Results
The field doesn't display any results and is reflected as empty, however, sometimes the values appear in the page

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Issue macro does not display paragraph field from Next-gen project intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
GIF images are being read as SVG images while exporting to pdf, which eventually throwing an exception that fails PDF export of a particular space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with TinyMce
 # Add a Gif to the page.
 # pubish and export it into PDF

h3. Expected Results
 It should export in PDF with no issues

h3. Actual Results
It failed to export.

h3. Workaround
In tiny editor manually resize the image and then export to pdf. This export will be successful.
fields.summary: Export to PDF issue : GIF images are being read as SVG images while exporting to pdf

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user (e.g. a JIRA user) is not licensed to use Confluence, they cannot view any Confluence content (from JIRA or Service Desk for instance) - even if that content is available to anonymous users. They currently have to log out before they can see the content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Enable anonymous access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/] to your Confluence Cloud site and space.
 # Open an incognito window and go to a page within the anonymous space
# On the top-right corner, click on the Log in icon ( !image-2021-03-16-18-34-58-261.png|thumbnail! ) and authenticate with a user that does not have a Confluence license, but has access to the site
# You should be redirected back to the anonymous space's page

h3. Expected Results
You can see the page

h3. Actual Results
Access restricted message is displayed

h3. Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: (Non-JSM) Allow unlicensed, authenticated users to have anonymous read only access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attaching a new .docx file to a page, you are unable to search for that file by its content.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach .docx file with a specific keyword, that doesn't have the file name in it to a page
 # Search for the keyword, the search doesn't locate file
 # Search for filename, the search does load file

h3. Expected Results

Provide the file and a preview of the contents in the search results.
h3. Actual Results

Search results won't provide either:
 * File name linked to the content searched for, or
 * A preview of the content of the file.

h3. Workaround

Contact Support to have them reindex the site.
fields.summary: Newly attached doc on page cannot search for its content

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Confluence user, I would like to be able to click a link that leads into an attachment and then preview it directly instead of just being redirected to the page where the file resides.

This is the current behavior in Fabric:

!Screen-Recording-2021-03-16-at-1(2).gif|width=300,height=200!

This was the standard behavior in tinyMCE:

!Screen-Recording-2021-03-16-at-1.gif|width=297,height=223!
h3. Why is this important

Reduces time that users take to interact with the file.

Assures the user that the file still exists
fields.summary: Directly preview attachments when clicking them from search

fields.description:
h4. Current scenario

When creating a page on Confluence Cloud, there is an unnecessary space between the toolbar and the breadcrumbs, that decreases the page visibility, when working on large pages.

!image-2021-03-16-12-08-23-336.png!
h4. Suggested solution

Decrease the spacing between these elements.
fields.summary: Decrease the distance between the editor toolbar and the breadcrumbs/page content

fields.description:
h4. Current scenario
On the Legacy editor, uploaded images were left aligned by default. On the current editor, images are center aligned by default.

h4. Suggested change
Left align images by default on the current editor.
fields.summary: Left align images by default on the current editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the macro is saved for the first time, the editing focus is being taken off the macro editor, placed on the Confluence editor, AND the macro is selected.  As a result, unless a user explicitly selects a text field, it remains there and if keystrokes are entered, the macro is replaced with the text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start a new Gliffy diagram.
# Add a shape and start typing characters, about 1 per second.
# Keep pressing until the "unpublished changes" badge appears. (15-30 seconds so about that many characters)
# Now keep typing a few characters. If properly triggered, you should not see any new characters appear.
# Publish the diagram, provide a filename, and exit to Confluence.
# Macro is not there and has been replaced by the text that was entered after the “unpublished changes”.

h3. Expected Results

The macro, which has just been in edit mode, should be in the place where the user just created it.

h3. Actual Results

The macro is not there and has been replaced by the text that was entered after the “unpublished changes”.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Typing during save cycle on a Confluence macro overwrites the macro

fields.description:
Currently, you can only change the variable value on creating a page, once the page is published, it will be a normal text now, and you can't change it anymore 
{panel:title=Steps to reproduce:|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
 - Create a template

 - Add variable type List

 - Save

 - Create a page from this template

 - Select value from the list variable

 - Publish the page

 - Edit the page

 - The variable is not available anymore. 


Expected Result : Variable should be available for published pages {panel}
fields.summary: Can't use variables in pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *JIRA Issue/Filter* macro, setting Table view and selecting a *Select List* custom fields under *Columns to display* will prevent the macro from displaying the results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Select List* custom field on Jira
 # Create an issue on Jira and set that field
 # In a Confluence page, insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro and find that issue created on step 2
 # Set the macro to *Table* under *Display Options*
 # Add the field created on step 1 to the *Columns to display*
 # Save the macro and publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA Issue/Filter macro should display the results
h3. Actual Results

The JIRA Issue/Filter macro will show the following error:
{quote}(!) Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in JIRA.
{quote}
No errors in the browser's console or in the requests.
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only available workaround is to remove the *Select List* custom field from the *Columns to display* in the Jira macro.
fields.summary: Jira macro can't list issues when there's a Select List custom field listed

fields.description:
Currently we can see space name, Categories, watch, star,more action columns in the “All Space”  directory but it is not possible to add more columns(EX: Description, Created by, KEY)? 

Please provide ability to add these fields.
fields.summary: Bring back the description field in space directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing a calendar in the space or /wiki/mycalendar URL, when you click on an event, it displays an error immediately.
Although this doesn't happen to all events, it seems to affect only recurring events, specifically events created on the old team calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a recurring event in Old Team Calendar. Event should be weekly and no day should be selected.
 # View the event in new Team Calendar.
 # Click on event.

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on the Calendar event will display the information on the event clicked and allow you to delete or edit the vent

h3. Actual Results
It returns a code error.

h3. Workaround
Create a new page and insert the Team Calendars macro. 
Search for the calendar in the Team Calendars macro and publish the page.
After that, the events should be clickable and if you want to delete an event for example, you should be able to.
fields.summary: Clicking on events in Team Calendars return a code error

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to select the date and the time using a Date Picker with Timestamp macro.

The main reason why this would benefit a user's instance would be having more informative and complete activities, like task tracking, new software versions, etc.
fields.summary: Add time to date macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After adding of Gatekeeper restrictions to fix [https://asecurityteam.atlassian.net/browse/VULN-197482] it caused the issue of dump unavailability of page export to PDF.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a non site/space admin perform page export to PDF 
 # Try to download a dump file via the provided link.

h3. Expected Results

Dump file is downloaded.
h3. Actual Results

403 http error is retrieved.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Fix of this issue was provided within [https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/CBM-513] and PR [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/pull-requests/19052/overview.]
Required action is to review tests coverage for export to PDF functionality.
fields.summary: Adding Gatekeeper restrictions to downloading of export dump caused page export to PDF issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have recently announced [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] for Confluence Cloud, which gives you the ability to generate a view-only link of a page, to be shared with unlicensed users. We are still gradually rolling out this functionality to our existing Cloud Instances.

We are also rolling out a new Global Permissions UI, with improved functionalities. 

However, on Instances in which the new Global Permissions UI is enabled, *but Public Links isn't available*, Anonymous access won't be visible on the Global Permissions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the Instance you are testing doesn't have Public Links, and the new Global Permissions UX is enabled.
 # Access the Global Permissions menu ({{/wiki/admin/permissions/global}})

h3. Expected Results

Anonymous access tab should be available, as the Instance doesn't have Public Links, so it can't be enabled.
h3. Actual Results

Anonymous access tab is not available.
h3. Workaround

You can access the old Global Permissions menu to manage Anon access ({{/wiki/admin/permissions/globalpermissions.action}})
fields.summary: Anonymous permission is not available on the new Global Permissions UX for Instances that don't have Public Links available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a page has a Jira macro and an image inside of a table, we won't be able to export it to PDF, causing an error during the export.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the current editor
# Add a Jira macro listing a few issues
# Add a table and insert an image inside (reproducible with PNG images)
This is an example of storage format that causes this problem:
 [^broken_storage.html] 
# Publish the page and try to export it to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The export should complete without problems

h3. Actual Results
The export fails, throwing a generic error:
{code:none}There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.{code}

The following error is thrown in the backend
{code:none}java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 1 out of bounds for length 1{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page with a Jira macro and an image inside of a table can't be exported to PDF

fields.description:
Create Confluence Context Parameter in Connect for Page Editor Version

Our vendors have requested a new context parameter for page editor version to determine if a page is legacy (v1) or fabric (v2)

Original ticket can be found [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-69625]

Investigation findings can be found [here|https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CCECO/pages/1047437875/Adding+New+Confluence+Context+Parameters+in+Connect]
fields.summary: Create Confluence Context Parameter in Connect for Page Editor Version

fields.description: There should be a possibility to automate PDF exports in Confluence and send via email to a set of users on weekly basis.
fields.summary: Export page as PDF and send it via email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
having a page with a Jira Issue macro that contains only a single issue, the macro will be transformed into a smart link on the first time the page gets edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert a Jira macro containing just a single issue
# Publish the page
# It will still be a *Jira macro*
# Edit the page

h3. Expected Results
It should remain as a Jira macro

h3. Actual Results
It gets converted to a smart link, as shown on my video:
-  [^jira_macro_link.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira macro with a single issue will be transformed on a link upon editing the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images that have effects on the legacy editor will be broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page that uses the legacy editor and has effects applied.

h3. Expected Results
The images should load

h3. Actual Results
The image's thumbnail will be broken and the following error is thrown at the browser's console:
{noformat}
GET https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/wiki/download/thumbnails/296124444/image.png?version=1&modificationDate=1615497767060&cacheVersion=1&api=v2&effects=drop-shadow&width=520&height=237 500
{noformat}

3. Notes
It's currently not possible to apply effects to new images, the image's properties won't save.

h3. Workaround
Either remove the effects from the image or [convert the page to the new editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/].
fields.summary: Images with effects on the legacy editor can't be displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When you upload a Word Doc (.docx) file to a *page*. Then you search for a key word that is located in that file. You will be presented with the file name, that the text exists in. However, we want there to be a preview of the text located under the file name in the search results. 

 
h3. How To Replicate
 # Upload Word Doc (.docx) file with a specific text string that contains a *keyword* placed in the file.
 # Use the Confluence Search bar to search for the *keyword*
 # The search will only return the file name that the *keyword* appears in
 # The customer wants the search output to provide a snippet of the text string that the *keyword* is located.

h3. Other Notes
fields.summary: Enrich Search results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 
Some customer's would wish that they have an option to remove /wiki/ from their confluence URL,
fields.summary: Add an option to remove /wiki/ from Confluence URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the instance *base url* the user will be redirected to Space Home, instead of the global view of the Space Home
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Further Configuration
 # Set one Space as the Instance home.
 # Now, access the Space through the new option created on the top navigation bar - note that the URL has the *mode=global*.
 # Now, access the Instance *base URL* ([instance.atlassian.net/wiki|http://instance.atlassian.net/wiki]).

h3. Expected Results

To load the Global View Point
h3. Actual Results

You access the space directly

h3. Workaround
No current work around.
fields.summary: Users accessing the Instance base URL are redirected to the Space defined as the Home, instead of the Global view of it

fields.description:
h2.Problem
Currently, Confluence allows site-admins to get the total storage size, however, it is not possible to get the size of each Confluence space.

h2.Suggestion
Adding an option to export storage details like spaces' size will allow site-admin to have more control over the Confluence environment.
fields.summary: Allow site-admins to export storage details like spaces' size

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook/] documentation for Cloud references a Server feature request instead of the Cloud version of the same ticket. I'm assuming this was before the code fork.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Visit [Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook/], scroll to the bottom:

!CleanShot 2021-03-11 at 15.15.08@2x.png|width=518,height=66!
h3. Expected Results

The link should link to the Cloud version, CONFCLOUD-51340.
h3. Actual Results

The link is to the Server version, CONFSERVER-51340 (formerly TEAMCAL-113).
h3. Workaround

Not applicable.
fields.summary: Cloud "Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook" documentation links to Server ticket

fields.description:
Currently, when invited to a Confluence Cloud instance, as a part of the onboarding process, users have a personal space created automatically.

The request is to allow Admins to configure a custom template with all the tasks that the new users should complete and that template should be added along with the personal space created automatically.
fields.summary: Ability to add the custom template created with the Personal space creation automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Setting First Day of Week in TC does not reflect on modern UI
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Calendar Settings. \{/wiki/admin/calendar/globalsettings.action}
 # select first day of week to anything like Tuesday.

h3. Expected Results

UI should display Tuesday as first day of week.
h3. Actual Results

Still displays Sunday as first day of week.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Setting First Day of Week in Team Calendar does not reflect on modern UI - Also, week Numbers is not seen

fields.description:
When you want to upload an attachment in Confluence Cloud - an image, video, or a document, there are currently two 3rd party providers for uploading files:
 - Google Drive
 - Dropbox

Some customers have security policies in place that restrict uploading to only local resources.

There should be an option to turn off any 3rd party integrations for uploading files in JIRA Cloud or have an option to switch one of the options off.
fields.summary: Disable 3rd party services such as Dropbox from being able to upload files in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
*Description:-*

Currently, when you create a Jira link in Confluence and it is shared with external users it is shown differently for Jira and non-Jira users. The non-Jira users will see the ticket number only. The Jira users will see the title also. So it is difficult for non-Jira users to get more context of the issue.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Take any instance with Jira and Confluence in it.
2) Create a Confluence page and insert a Jira link in it.
3) Ask two users( one with access to Jira and the other without) to view the same page.
4) The user without Jira access will see only the Jira ticket number in the Jira link. The user with Jira access with see the Jira ticket title along with the ticket number.

*Suggested resolution:-*

Provide ability so that the admin can configure the Jira fields can be exposed to non-Jira users using the link option.
fields.summary: Provide facility so that Jira link display fields are configurable.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pages with a large number of static macros do not render reliably. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 100 static macros to a page.
 # View the page.

h3. Expected Results

The page renders reliably.
h3. Actual Results

The page intermittently fails to render. See screenshots.

When inspecting the developer console, the following response can be seen in the {{<site>/cgraphql?q=MacroContentRendererQuery}} requests:
{code}
{"errors":[{
"message":"Exception querying the remote GraphQL service: io.atlassian.platform.micros.asynchttp.UnexpectedHttpStatusResponseException: Unexpected status code 500",
"locations":[{"line":2,"column":3}],
"path":["contentRenderer"],"extensions":{"statusCode":"500"}}],
"data":{"contentRenderer":null}}
{code}

In the logs on the Atlassian end, the error relates to the following:
{code}
Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: 
Unable to acquire JDBC Connection
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Failed rendering of pages with a large number of static macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page views events on mobile web are getting fired and therefore not captured in confluence analytics


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a page on mobile safari (issue can also be reproduced by using the devices toolbar in chrome devtools). 
 # Then from desktop view the page analytics for this page.  Your name should appear on this list of having viewed the page (within a few minutes)


h3. Expected Results

Your name should appear as having viewed the page a few seconds ago.  
h3. Actual Results

 

Analytics is not reporting that you viewed the page.
h3. Workaround

Use desktop browser to capture page views.
fields.summary: Page views events on mobile web are getting fired and therefore not captured in confluence analytics

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA and create 101 new filters with a similar title, like _Filter 1_, _Filter 2_, _Filter 3_, for example (you can create them using the REST API endpoint {{/rest/api/3/filter}});
# Go to Confluence and create a new page;
# Add the *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* macro;
# In the macro's quick find filter field, type "_Filter_".

h3. Expected Results
All the 101 results should be shown there.

h3. Actual Results
It appears that due to a limitation in the UI, only the first 100 results will be listed.

*Notes*
* On my test, I used a script to create the JIRA filters, and then, going to the macro, I manually checked the results that came in the macro list and could see that the "_Filter 24_" was missing from the list - all the other 100 were there.

h3. Workaround
Change the search parameter - in my case, if I type "_24_", I'm able to find my filter.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro only shows 100 results when searching for a filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For some spaces the customers are experiencing page tree loading issue with below error - 
!image-2021-03-10-21-58-15-913.png|width=111,height=179!
 The issue is happening due to a page in page tree having no title.
 This can be seen in the *Space Settings* ---> *Content Tools* ---> *Reorder Pages* as below - 
 !image-2021-03-10-21-51-10-502.png|width=280,height=42!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check the page tree for which the error code is appearing
 # Look into the reorder pages for getting link to that page without title.

h3. Expected Results

The page tree should be loading fine.
h3. Actual Results

Title for a random page was missing . These pages are not any recent created pages. Due to missing title, the page tree for it fails to load
h3. Workaround

After getting link to the page, place a Title for the page, to let it load in page tree.
fields.summary: [Customer Support SLO] Random removal of some page title causing error in page tree loading

fields.description:
Heading styles currently require pressing 4 keys on an Azerty keyboard.

In order to get 
{code:java}
ctrl-alt-1{code}
shortcut on an Azerty keyboard where 1 = shift-& you need to press 4 keys 
{code:java}
ctrl-alt-shift-&{code}
 

Please consider making this a user preference of add following alternatives
 * ctrl-alt-& for  ctrl-alt-1
 * ctrl-alt-é for ctrl-alt-2
 * ctrl-alt-" for ctrl-alt-3
 * ctrl-alt-' for ctrl-alt-4
 * ctrl-alt-( for ctrl-alt-5
 * ctrl-alt-§ for ctrl-alt-6
 * ctrl-alt-à for ctrl-alt-0

 

see [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-change-Confluence-Cloud-keyboard-shortcuts-for-Azerty/qaq-p/1631964?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=accept_as_solution_reminder&utm_content=topic]

 

Could not find Confluence cloud as component so I selected Confluence Cloud Premium.
fields.summary: Support Azerty keyboards in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing a Jira macro through a page properties report, the macro will keep loading forever.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page A with a page properties macro
# Add a jira macro inside of the page properties's table
# Add a label to the page and publish page A
# Create page B with a page properties report macro, configured to the same label as step 3
# Publish page B

h3. Expected Results
The Jira macro should load the issue's details

h3. Actual Results
The macro will display "Getting issue details" forever

h3. Workaround
* Edit the page and publish it again.
* Manually put the Jira issue in the  page, outside of the Page properties report
fields.summary: Jira issues inside of a page properties report won't load

fields.description:
While it is possible to change the navigation bar color from many options in the Confluence Settings, the search box in the navigation bar also uses the same color as the navigation bar.

It would be useful to have a way to change either the search box's color to highlight the search box or at least change the color for the placeholder written "Search", as the default color is grey and depending on the navigation bar color chosen, it can be unreadable as it is too dark, or a problem for someone with colorblind issues.
fields.summary: Ability to change the Search box or the placeholder for the Confluence Search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When your account preferences are set to Chinese, it is not possible to create events on the new Confluence Cloud Calendars experience.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to your [Account Preferences|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] and change the language to Chinese (中文 (简体));
# Go to Confluence and access the New Calendar experience;
# Try to create a weekly event.

h3. Expected Results
The weekly event is created.

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown in the screen.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accounts set up to Chinese language cannot create Calendar events

fields.description: I have a customer who has consultants and a small number of partners in their environment (third party), and they would like to have the user’s access expire on a specific date so that they don’t have to manually remove access.
fields.summary: Expiration Date Capabilities on Confluence Cloud User Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Gadget macros don't load on the page.
 * Macros (so far):
 ** Sprint Health Gadget
 ** Sprint Burndown Gadget
** Created vs. Resolved Chart
** Issue statistics

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Sprint Health Gadget* to a page, and save it.
 # On the view mode from the page, go to *More actions>Advanced details>View Storage Format* and check that there is no reference to the macro.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget loads with no issues.
h3. Actual Results

No sign of the macro on the page.
h3. Workaround

Currently, you need to edit the macro and change the parameter *Width* from +450+ to +auto+, save it, and the macro should load with no further issues.

If the step above doesn't work, you can visit another page from the space sidebar and go back to the one with the macros. Refreshing the page doesn't work.
fields.summary: Jira Gadget macros shows blank

Sorting table column is not possible with task macro(check box)

h3. Issue Summary

When I insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro on a Confluence page as a table and
If the page is then exported to Word, the table either runs off the page (Word) or columns are missing entirely.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The results should be the same as the view mode of the page or in the normal view of the exported word document.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we add the following string to a page's title using the legacy editor, it will break the TOC macro:
{code:none}"<this>"{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the legacy editor
# Put {{"<this>"}} at the beginning of its title
# Add a TOC macro and some headings
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The table of contents should be rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
Parts of the title will leak into the link's title
|  !image-2021-03-08-22-47-01-858.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Either remove {{"<this>"}} from the title or [convert the page to the current editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/].
fields.summary: "<this>" in a page title will break the Table of Contents on the legacy editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Page's toolbar/header appears and disappears immediately after scrolling the page up when there are PDF files at the bottom of the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Add content to this page
# At the bottom of the page, add 2 or more PDF files
# Save the page
# Go to the bottom of the page and start to scroll up

h3. Expected Results
Page's toolbar appears and doesn't disappear when scrolling up the page.

h3. Actual Results
Page's toolbar/header appears and disappears immediately after scrolling the page up.

h3. Workaround
Remove the PDFs from the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Page's toolbar appears and disappears immediately after rolling the page up

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Generally, it is possible to add custom fields in the columns to show in the Jira issue macro on Confluence, however, if the issue type/custom field is from the Tempo Plugin, this is not possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On Jira:
 # Install the [Tempo plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6572/tempo-timesheets-time-tracking-reports?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] from the Market Place
 # On a Jira Project, create an issue and choose the issue type
# Go to the *Project Settings > Screens* and click on the default screen scheme for the issue type used in the issue created
# Add the Account custom field from Tempo in Configure Screen
# Go to the *Tempo* add-on (click on apps > ) >  *Account* in the left sidebar
# Click on *+Create Account* and add the required information (Name, Key, Lead) and hit Create
# Click on the Account name just created and click on +Add Project Link
# Select the Project where you have created the jira issue

On Confluence:
# Go to a Confluence Page
# Add the Jira issue macro
# Copy the link from the Jira issue and paste on the macro
# Click on Display Options and switch to Table
# On Columns to display, add the custom field Account (you can also add another custom field not related to tempo to compare)

h3. Expected Results
The column would display the custom field from Tempo (e.g: Account)

h3. Actual Results
The column from the custom field from tempo is not shown on the Jira issue macro, but other custom fields from Jira are.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field types from Tempo are not populating in Jira issue macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have recently released [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] for Confluence Cloud, which gives you the ability to generate a view-only link of a page, to be shared with unlicensed users. However, it is not possible to use *Public Links* in case *Anonymous access* is enabled on the Instance. In this regard, if *Public Links is enabled*, *Anon permission won't be visible on the Global Permissions*. 

However, on the new Global Permissions UX (currently being rolled out on Cloud Instances), Anon permission won't be visible on the Global Permissions, even if Public Links is disabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the Instance you are testing have Public Links available, and the new Global Permissions UX is also enabled.
 # Access the Public Links menu, and make sure it is not enabled ({{/wiki/admin/public-links}}).
# Access the Global Permissions menu ({{/wiki/admin/permissions/global}})

h3. Expected Results
Anonymous access tab should be available, as Public Links is *disabled*.
h3. Actual Results
Anonymous access tab is not available.

h3. Workaround
You can access the old Global Permissions menu to manage Anon access ({{/wiki/admin/permissions/globalpermissions.action}})
fields.summary: Anonymous permission is not available on the new Global Permissions UX even if Public Links is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you edit the Global templates and edit it, it shows up with on space Global page templates section.
Please note: it shows even if the template is disabled from Global Templates and Blueprints.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Edit any in-house/default template. ( Specifically, name/title so you can recognize it in space >> content tool section)
 # You can edit, meeting notes, or how-to(not that it's not limited to these two templates only)


h3. Expected Results
It should not show the template on the space section 

h3. Actual Results
 # It will show in Space section
 # To test further you can disable the Template in Global settings > It will still show the template in space section >> Global page templates


h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Global Template shows in space Global page templates when edited.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39834].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On the first login on Confluence, users are forced to start watching a space so they can go through "Welcome" screens. This is not ideal especially if users don't even know if the contents are relevant when first signing in.

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be a "Skip" button.
 
h3. Workaround

Un-watch the space after onboarding
fields.summary: Allow users to go through Welcome screen without having to start watching a space

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] feature is enabled, it won't be possible to enable anonymous access to Confluence.

(i) The [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] documentation already mentions [anonymous access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/], but not the other way around.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve our [Set up public access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/] documentation to mention that if [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] is enabled, we can't enable anonymous access.
fields.summary: Improve Set up public access documentation to mention public links

h3. Issue Summary

When you insert PDF Macro and fill in the fields in the form if you have entered the name of the page the PDF macro won't show a preview and won't add the PDF to the page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page
 # Add PDF Macro
 # Type in the name of the page and choose the file from the dropdown

The preview shows you the first page of the document. Once you hit Save the content of the PDF should be added to the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an event on the Team Calendar, if you try to add an Issue Type that contains the word [System] it will not validate the JQL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With Confluence Premium, creates a Team Calendar;
 # Create an Event with the Event - Type Jira Issue Dates
 # Select the display JQL (Advanced)
 # Add in the JQL: issuetype = "[System] Change"

h3. Expected Results

The JQL is valid and the event is created.
h3. Actual Results

Invalid JQL.
h3. Workaround

Use the issue type ID for issue types that contain the system name. To find the ID in Jira, go to settings > issues > issue types and find the desired issue type. Click on edit, the number that will appear on the URL is the ID of the issue type.
fields.summary: You cannot add an issue type that contains [System] in a JQL for the Team Calendar

fields.description:

When we paste multiple images into a page and set them to wrap left or right, if we place the images one at the side of each other, the first image will have a spacing that is not consistent with the other ones.

 # Create a page;
 # Change the page to full-width (it is easier to reproduce it);
 # Take a random screenshot, but not too big (to also make it easier to reproduce the bug), and paste it into the page;
 # Select the image and click over the *Wrap Left* option;
 # Repeat steps *#3* and *#4* two more times, pasting the images right after each other.

h3. Expected Results

The three images have the same spacing between each other.

The spacing between the first and second images is different than what we have between the second and third images.

!image-2021-03-04-11-38-05-914.png|width=914,height=261!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Marketplace Partner originally raised this request here [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/public-link-of-confluence-page-get-via-api/45352]
h2. Feature request

The ability to get the new [Public Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] url from Confluence via an API
h2. Use Case

The use case for the [Meetical Meetings for Confluence App|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222405/meetical-meetings-for-confluence-calendar-app?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] is the following. Our App allows you to create a Confluence Meeting Notes page directly from Google Calendar events via Browser Extension and also from Outlook via Outlook Add-in. Do you remember my Arizona App Week presentation?  In both cases we add a link to the page below for easy access to the agenda and meeting minutes. Currently this is the “internal” Confluence page link. But especially for meeting notes, shared with customers and partners, it would be amazing, and has been requested from users, that the page can be made available to extenals with a special link.
fields.summary: Get the Public link of Confluence page via API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

TLDR - some contentIds take very long to index. This has resulted in 90% of the content not being searchable for some tenants.

 

Explanation:

We use ADF extraction code in the indexing flow. When a reindex job runs, 25 contentIds are extracted in a single batch and we extract all fields for them. One of the fields contentBody is populated with ADF extracted content. There is clear indication that this ContentBodyIndexerExtractor takes several seconds in some cases.

Side effect of this: We have no activity for 5 min ( if the 25 contentIds take longer than 5 min in total) and the job gets timed out - all pending tasks are marked as dead and this is very bad for our customers.

This PIR action item is in progress now: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-71555
but it is only a bandaid. And the root cause needs to be figured out.

We cannot increase the timeout of the job for this because that would not be the right way to fix this. We cannot increase the batch size for reindexing because that would degrade the performance of progress tracking - too many entries in DB.

Please take a look at [https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/CCB/pages/7399801505/DoS+ticket+-+investigation#Specific-details]

There are some more contentIds as well on the page to reproduce the issue

 

Some staging contentIds:

Searchable ari:cloud:confluence:bf1ad8f0-f9da-4c3e-ac67-d73f6e394bc4:page/899784974 did not complete extraction in time 12 seconds

Searchable ari:cloud:confluence:bf1ad8f0-f9da-4c3e-ac67-d73f6e394bc4:page/899817407 did not complete extraction in time 12 seconds

 

More logs here: [https://splunk.paas-inf.net/en-US/app/search/search?q=search eventtype%3D"micros_confluence-dev-us*" "Searchable* did not complete extraction in time*"&display.page.search.mode=smart&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&earliest=-4h%40m&latest=now&sid=1614299614.114191_08994721-1899-43E7-8F3A-864FED18C26C|https://splunk.paas-inf.net/en-US/app/search/search?q=search%20eventtype%3D%22micros_confluence-dev-us*%22%20%22Searchable*%20did%20not%20complete%20extraction%20in%20time*%22&display.page.search.mode=smart&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&earliest=-4h%40m&latest=now&sid=1614299614.114191_08994721-1899-43E7-8F3A-864FED18C26C]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Debug index doc of contentID *20317139* on tenant *87f5de64-c7ac-4293-9756-0a6b0e91e24d* using */wiki/rest/internal/1.0/index/document?contentId=**20317139***
 # Observe how long it takes to return response
 # There are other contentIds too : eg: 20317146. Most seem to be pages with some bad storage body content

h3. Expected Results

Should index quickly
h3. Actual Results

Takes several seconds to extract ADF. You can observe the time here:

[https://atlassian.signalfx.com/#/temp/chart/Evgq0UfA0AA]

 
{noformat}
 {noformat}
h3. Workaround

No existing workaround.
fields.summary: ContentIds take too long to extract ADF

fields.description:
Steps :
 # In Confluence and Google Chrome, edit a page, then create a table (make sure it has a header) with as many rows as you want tickets.
 # In the header, uniquely title your columns (Summary, Description, and so on).
 # Fill in ticket summaries and descriptions.
 # Publish or Update the page (so that you're not in edit mode).
 # Select the text of the first summary. In the tiny menu that appears, click the Jira icon.
 # In the Create Task window, make sure the Jira project and ticket type are correct, then click *Create multiple issues from table.*
 # In the C*reate Multiple Issues window*, you are being asked which table column contains Summary text, and which contains Description text .
 # Now select "*create single issue*", 
 # In the C*reate single issue window*, you are not asked which table column contains Summary text, and which contains Description text. Everything you just select before creating an issue comes in the summary field

Mapping should also be available for single issue .
fields.summary: Create single jira issue from table doesn't show column mappings
